Developer Interface¶

Classes¶

class gutter.RainwaveClient(user_id=0, key=u'')¶

A RainwaveClient object provides a simple interface to the Rainwave API (see http://rainwave.cc/api/ for details about the API).

Parameters:
  • user_id – User ID to use when communicating with the API.
  • key – API key to use when communicating with the API.
base_url = u'http://rainwave.cc/'¶

URL upon which all API calls are based.

call(path, args={})¶

Makes a direct call to the API if you know the necessary path and arguments.

Parameters:
  • path – URL path of the API method to call.
  • args – (optional) Dictionary of any arguments required by the API method.

Usage:

>>> from gutter import RainwaveClient
>>> rw = RainwaveClient(5049, u'abcde12345')
>>> rw.call(u'async/1/album', {u'album_id': 1})
{u'playlist_album': {u'album_name': u'Wild Arms', ...}}
channels¶

A List of RainwaveChannel objects associated with this RainwaveClient object.

key = u''¶

API key to use when communicating with the API. Find your API key at http://rainwave.cc/auth/.

user_id = 0¶

User ID to use when communicating with the API. Find your User ID at http://rainwave.cc/auth/.

class gutter.RainwaveChannel(client, raw_info)¶

A RainwaveChannel object represents one channel on the Rainwave network.

Note

You should not instantiate an object of this class directly, but rather obtain one from RainwaveClient.channels.

Parameters:
  • client – the RainwaveClient parent object.
  • raw_info – a dictionary of information provided by the API that describes this channel.
albums¶

A list of RainwaveAlbum objects in the playlist of this channel.

artists¶

A list of RainwaveArtist objects in the playlist of this channel.

description¶

A description of the channel.

get_album_by_id(id)¶

Returns a RainwaveAlbum for the given album ID. Raises an IndexError if there is no album with the given ID in the playlist of this channel.

Parameters:id (int) – ID of the desired album.
id¶

The ID of the channel.

name¶

The name of the channel.

oggstream¶

The URL of the OGG stream for the channel.

start_sync()¶

Begin syncing the timeline for this channel.

stop_sync()¶

Stop syncing the timeline for this channel.

stream¶

The URL of the MP3 stream for the channel.
